Sketching the Base Face 1. Create the base face of the rectangular prism by drawing a closed loop with the following line segments: - Line 1: Starting at (0.0, 0.0) and ending at (0.75, 0.0) - Line 2: Starting at (0.75, 0.0) and ending at (0.75, 0.3981) - Line 3: Starting at (0.75, 0.3981) and ending at (0.0, 0.3981) - Line 4: Starting at (0.0, 0.3981) and ending at (0.0, 0.0) Creating the Circular Holes 1. Create the first circular hole on the base face: - Draw a circle centered at (0.0975, 0.1991) with a radius of 0.0475 2. Create the second circular hole on the base face: - Draw a circle centered at (0.6525, 0.1991) with a radius of 0.0475 Scaling the Sketch Scale the completed sketch by a factor of 0.75 to adjust its size. Extruding the Sketch 1. Extrude the scaled and constrained sketch along the normal by a distance of 0.2676, creating a 3D solid model. 2. Set the extrusion depth of the opposite normal to 0.0. Now, you have completed part 1, the rectangular prism with two circular holes. *Shape*: A rectangular prism with two circular holes on opposite sides, one on the top and one on the bottom. The holes are centered on the longer sides of the prism. The prism is illuminated from the front, creating a bright spot on the opposite side. *Length*: 0.75 units *Width*: 0.75 units *Height*: 0.2676 units Repeat the above steps for any additional parts based on the provided 'CAD Assembly JSON'.</description>
